channel.title: The Northwest Boardroom Podcasting Network (mp3)
channel.description: The Northwest Boardroom Podcasting network is the broadcast arm of The Northwest Boardroom LLC based in the Pacific Northwest. Typical topics are leadership, sales, small business organizational development and “The 5 Choices” from Gower D. Talley’s book “5 Things I learned on the Road to he Dream”
channel.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
channel.itunes:summary: The Northwest Boardroom Podcasting network is the broadcast arm of The Northwest Boardroom LLC based in the Pacific Northwest. Typical topics are leadership, sales, small business organizational development and “The 5 Choices” from Gower D. Talley’s book “5 Things I learned on the Road to he Dream”
channel.itunes:keywords: small business, leadership, training, sales, consulting, greatness, excellence, gower talley

item.title: Goals (and the Big Lie)
item.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of The Northwest Boardroom Podcast, Gower D. Talley illustrates the importance of Goals by exposing the biggest lie ever told.
item.description: In this episode of The Northwest Boardroom Podcast, Gower D. Talley illustrates the importance of Goals by exposing the biggest lie ever told.

item.title: Power Lunch Track 16 – Conclusion
item.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
item.itunes:summary: This sample track to the Power Lunch Sales Training Program is the end of program wrap up.
item.description: This sample track to the Power Lunch Sales Training Program is the end of program wrap up.

item.title: Power Lunch Track 11 – Review
item.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
item.itunes:summary: This sample track to the Power Lunch Sales Training Program is the mid program review. You can get a general feel for the material that precedes this track.
item.description: This sample track to the Power Lunch Sales Training Program is the mid program review. You can get a general feel for the material that precedes this track.

item.title: Power Lunch Track 8 – Find Out what they want.
item.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
item.itunes:summary: In this sample track to the Power Lunch Sales Training Program – Gower D. Talley introduces the idea of finding out what our prospect wants as a mandatory first step to telling your prospects that you have what they want.
item.description: In this sample track to the Power Lunch Sales Training Program – Gower D. Talley introduces the idea of finding out what our prospect wants as a mandatory first step to telling your prospects that you have what they want.

item.title: The SALES Power lunch
item.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
item.itunes:summary: This Podcast episode is the introduction to the Northwest Boardroom SALES Power Lunch – A complete entry level sales foundation – in 75 minutes. If you like this – you can find the rest of the program at www.thenorthwestboardroom.com or on Itunes by searching for “Sales Training”
item.description: This Podcast episode is the introduction to the Northwest Boardroom SALES Power Lunch – A complete entry level sales foundation – in 75 minutes. If you like this – you can find the rest of the program at www.thenorthwestboardroom.com or on Itunes by searching for “Sales Training”

item.title: #5 Happiness!
item.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
item.itunes:summary: Over the next several podcasts – Northwest Boardroom President Gower D. Talley will introduce the 5 key personal choices from his book – 5 Things I learned on the Road to the Dream. Today Gower will discuss the 1st of the 5 choices – Happiness.
item.description: Over the next several podcasts – Northwest Boardroom President Gower D. Talley will introduce the 5 key personal choices from his book – 5 Things I learned on the Road to the Dream. Today Gower will discuss the 1st of the 5 choices – Happiness.

item.title: #4 The Worst Salesman in the World!
item.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Northwest Boardroom president Gower D. Talley tells the story of the worst salesman in the world. Some people’s purpose is to serve as a bad example for the rest of us.
item.description: In this episode, Northwest Boardroom president Gower D. Talley tells the story of the worst salesman in the world. Some people’s purpose is to serve as a bad example for the rest of us.

item.title: #3 You are almost there!
item.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Northwest Boardroom President Gower D. Talley brings a fresh perspective to the Theory of Constraints and illustrates that many originations are already closer to success than they realize. www.thenorthwestboardroom.com
item.description: In this episode, Northwest Boardroom President Gower D. Talley brings a fresh perspective to the Theory of Constraints and illustrates that many originations are already closer to success than they realize. www.thenorthwestboardroom.com

item.title: #2 Go With Your Gut!
item.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
item.itunes:summary: In this episode The Northwest Boardroom President Gower D. Talley discusses logical and emotional decision making, how we attempt to influence each type of decision and he makes some surprising observations.
item.description: In this episode The Northwest Boardroom President Gower D. Talley discusses logical and emotional decision making, how we attempt to influence each type of decision and he makes some surprising observations.

item.title: #1 Typical Leadership vs. Extraordinary Leadership
item.itunes:author: The Northwest Boardroom
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Northwest Boardroom President Gower D Talley discusses the difference between a typical leadership environment and the extraordinary leadership environment that is possible within your organization. www.thenorthwestboardroom.com
item.description: In this episode, Northwest Boardroom President Gower D Talley discusses the difference between a typical leadership environment and the extraordinary leadership environment that is possible within your organization. www.thenorthwestboardroom.com
item.itunes:keywords: leadership, gower talley, greatness, consultant, growth
